Interface ICheckerBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbsCheckerBoard, CheckerBoard, CheckerBoardMem
public interface ICheckerBoard
ICheckerBoard is an interface for a standard checkerboard. This interface defines the basic behaviors of a checkerboard such as moving and placing pieces, crowning and jumping, and accessors regarding board info and victory status.

    • getPlayerOne

      char getPlayerOne()
      Accessor for a board's dimensions.
      Returns:
      char representing player one

    • getPlayerTwo

      char getPlayerTwo()
      Accessor for a board's dimensions.
      Returns:
      char representing player two

    • getDimensions

      int getDimensions()
      Accessor for a board's dimensions.
      Returns:
      int representing the size of the board

    • getViableDirections

      HashMap<Character, ArrayList<DirectionEnum>> getViableDirections()
      Accessor for the viableDirections HashMap.
      Returns:
      mapping of each player to their list of viable movement directions

    • getPieceCounts

      HashMap<Character, Integer> getPieceCounts()
      Accessor for the pieceCount HashMap.
      Returns:
      mapping of each player to number of pieces remaining

    • placePiece

      void placePiece(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      Places a player's checker on the board at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position to place the checker.
      player - The player's character (e.g., 'X' or 'O').

    • whatsAtPos

      char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
      Returns the character of the player at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position to check.
      Returns:
      The player's character, or a space ' ' if empty

    • movePiece

      default BoardPosition movePiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      Moves a piece from startingPos in the given direction if valid.
      Parameters:
      startingPos - The position of the piece to move.
      dir - The direction to move in.
      Returns:
      the new BoardPosition after moving

    • jumpPiece

      default BoardPosition jumpPiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      Jumps a piece from startingPos in the given direction if valid.
      Parameters:
      startingPos - The position of the piece to jump.
      dir - The direction to jump in.
      Returns:
      the new BoardPosition after the jump

    • crownPiece

      default void crownPiece(BoardPosition posOfPlayer)
      Makes the piece at posOfPlayer a king.
      Parameters:
      posOfPlayer - The position of the piece to crown.

    • checkPlayerWin

      default boolean checkPlayerWin(Character player)
      Checks if the specified player has won.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to check.
      Returns:
      true if the player has no opponent pieces remaining on the board

    • scanSurroundingPositions

      default HashMap<DirectionEnum, Character> scanSurroundingPositions(BoardPosition startingPos)
      Returns a map of directions to characters located diagonally around a given board position
      Parameters:
      startingPos - the origin position to scan around
      Returns:
      map of DirectionEnum to character at the adjacent diagonal position
